title: Concentration-QTc modeling example
text: data set extended following: add individual baseline QTcF (BL_QTCF): DQTCF=ΔQTcFi,t=QTcFi,t−QTcFi,predoseDQTCF = \Delta QTcF_{,t} = QTcF_{,t} - QTcF_{,predose} calculate population mean baseline QTcF treatment group (PM_BL_QTCF): PM_BL_QTF=QTc0¯PM\_BL\_QTF = \overline {QTc_0} calculate difference individual baseline QTcF respective population mean baseline QTcF: DPM_BL_QTCF=QTci,j=0−QTc0¯DPM\_BL\_QTCF = QTc_{,j=0} - \overline {QTc_0} calculate difference DQTCF group mean DQTCF control population time point (DDQTCF): DDQTCF=ΔΔQTcFi,t=ΔQTcFi,t−ΔQTcFcontrol,t¯DDQTCF = \Delta \Delta QTcF_{,t} = \Delta QTcF_{,t} - \overline{\Delta QTcF_{control,t}} change numeric nominal time field (NTIME) factors
code: dof <- dofetilide_cqtc %>%   cqtc_add_baseline("QTCF", baseline_filter = "NTIME == -0.5") %>%    add_bl_popmean("BL_QTCF") %>%   mutate(DPM_BL_QTCF = BL_QTCF - PM_BL_QTCF) %>%   derive_group_delta("DQTCF") %>%    mutate(NTIME = as.factor(NTIME))

title: Concentration-QTc modeling example
code: rr_plot(dof, "QT", group = "ACTIVE") rr_plot(dof, "QTCF", group = "ACTIVE")

title: Concentration-QTc modeling example
code: cqtc_time_course_plot(dof, "QTCF") cqtc_hysteresis_plot(dof, "DDQTCF")

title: Concentration-QTc modeling example
code: cqtc_ntile_plot(dof, lm = TRUE, loess = TRUE) #> Warning in geom_smooth(aes(x = .data$mean_conc, y = .data$mean), method = #> "loess", : Ignoring unknown parameters: `lwd`

title: Concentration-QTc modeling example
code: mod <- lmerTest::lmer(   DQTCF ~ NTIME + ACTIVE + DPM_BL_QTCF + CONC + (CONC||ID),   data = dof)  # parameter estimates temp <- as.data.frame(coef(summary(mod, ddf="Kenward-Roger"))) colnames(temp) <- c("estimate", "se", "df", "t", "p") parameters <- temp %>%   mutate(     rse = se/estimate * 100,       lci = estimate + qt(0.025, df = df) * se,       uci = estimate + qt(0.975, df = df) * se,       p = ifelse(p < 0.001, "< 0.001", signif(p, 3))) %>%   select(estimate, lci, uci, rse, p)  parameters %>%    kable(caption = "Model parameters") grid <- ref.grid(   mod,   at = list(     CONC = seq(0, max(dof$CONC, na.rm = TRUE)),     ACTIVE = c(FALSE, TRUE),     DPM_BL_QTCF = 0))  temp1 <- summary(lsmeans::lsmeans(   grid,   c("CONC", "ACTIVE"),   level = 0.9)) %>%   filter(ACTIVE == TRUE)  dof %>%   cqtc_ntile_plot(param = "DQTCF", n = 10) +   geom_line(data = temp1, aes(x = CONC, y = lsmean)) +   geom_ribbon(     data = temp1,     aes(x = CONC, ymin = lower.CL, ymax = upper.CL, y = lsmean),     alpha = 0.2)

title: Concentration-QTc modeling example
code: invisible(capture.output(   cqtc_gof_plot(mod) ))

title: Concentration-QTc modeling example
text: data set extended following: add individual baseline QTcF (BL_QTCF): DQTCF=ΔQTcFi,t=QTcFi,t−QTcFi,predoseDQTCF = \Delta QTcF_{,t} = QTcF_{,t} - QTcF_{,predose} calculate population mean baseline QTcF treatment group (PM_BL_QTCF): PM_BL_QTF=QTc0¯PM\_BL\_QTF = \overline {QTc_0} calculate difference individual baseline QTcF respective population mean baseline QTcF: DPM_BL_QTCF=QTci,j=0−QTc0¯DPM\_BL\_QTCF = QTc_{,j=0} - \overline {QTc_0} calculate difference DQTCF group mean DQTCF control population time point (DDQTCF): DDQTCF=ΔΔQTcFi,t=ΔQTcFi,t−ΔQTcFcontrol,t¯DDQTCF = \Delta \Delta QTcF_{,t} = \Delta QTcF_{,t} - \overline{\Delta QTcF_{control,t}} change numeric nominal time field (NTIME) factors
code: dof <- dofetilide_cqtc %>%   cqtc_add_baseline("QTCF", baseline_filter = "NTIME == -0.5") %>%    add_bl_popmean("BL_QTCF") %>%   mutate(DPM_BL_QTCF = BL_QTCF - PM_BL_QTCF) %>%   derive_group_delta("DQTCF") %>%    mutate(NTIME = as.factor(NTIME))

title: Concentration-QTc modeling example
code: mod <- lmerTest::lmer(   DQTCF ~ NTIME + ACTIVE + DPM_BL_QTCF + CONC + (CONC||ID),   data = dof)  # parameter estimates temp <- as.data.frame(coef(summary(mod, ddf="Kenward-Roger"))) colnames(temp) <- c("estimate", "se", "df", "t", "p") parameters <- temp %>%   mutate(     rse = se/estimate * 100,       lci = estimate + qt(0.025, df = df) * se,       uci = estimate + qt(0.975, df = df) * se,       p = ifelse(p < 0.001, "< 0.001", signif(p, 3))) %>%   select(estimate, lci, uci, rse, p)  parameters %>%    kable(caption = "Model parameters") grid <- ref.grid(   mod,   at = list(     CONC = seq(0, max(dof$CONC, na.rm = TRUE)),     ACTIVE = c(FALSE, TRUE),     DPM_BL_QTCF = 0))  temp1 <- summary(lsmeans::lsmeans(   grid,   c("CONC", "ACTIVE"),   level = 0.9)) %>%   filter(ACTIVE == TRUE)  dof %>%   cqtc_ntile_plot(param = "DQTCF", n = 10) +   geom_line(data = temp1, aes(x = CONC, y = lsmean)) +   geom_ribbon(     data = temp1,     aes(x = CONC, ymin = lower.CL, ymax = upper.CL, y = lsmean),     alpha = 0.2)

title: Concentration-QTc modeling example
code: invisible(capture.output(   cqtc_gof_plot(mod) ))

code: @Manual{,   title = {cqtc: Conduct concentration-QTc analysis},   author = {Rainer Strotmann},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 0.3.7}, }

title: Conduct concentration-QTc analysis
text: package provides functions streamline concentration-QTc analysis clinical ECG data.

title: Conduct concentration-QTc analysis
text: can install development version cqtc like :
code: devtools::install_github("rstrotmann/cqtc")

title: Conduct concentration-QTc analysis
text: basic building block analyses cqtc() data object. package includes data dofetilide verapamil copied Parkinson, J., Dota, C. & Rekić, D. Practical guide concentration-QTc modeling: hands-tutorial. J Pharmacokinet Pharmacodyn 52, 43 (2025). https://doi.org/10.1007/s10928-025-09981-8. following basic example shows create exploratory c-QTc plot dofetilide data set. analysis, including linear mixed effects modeling, see vignette("cqtc").
code: library(cqtc) library(nif) #>  #> Attaching package: 'nif' #> The following objects are masked from 'package:cqtc': #>  #>     add_ntile, subjects library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: 'dplyr' #> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union  dof <- dofetilide_cqtc %>%   cqtc_add_baseline("QTCF", baseline_filter = "NTIME == -0.5") %>%    add_bl_popmean("BL_QTCF") %>%   mutate(DPM_BL_QTCF = BL_QTCF - PM_BL_QTCF) %>%   derive_group_delta("DQTCF") %>%    mutate(NTIME = as.factor(NTIME))  cqtc_ntile_plot(dof, lm = TRUE, loess = TRUE)

Title — auto_cqtc
code: auto_cqtc(   sdtm,   treatment = NULL,   pc_analyte = NULL,   eg_analyte = c(QTCF = "QTCF", HR = "HR", RR = "RR", QT = "QTGDUR"),   egcat = "CENTRAL ECG",   ntime_method = "TPT",   NTIME_lookup = NULL,   silent = NULL,   verbose = TRUE )

title: Title — auto_cqtc
text: sdtm sdtm object. treatment EXTRT. pc_analyte PCTESTCD. eg_analyte EGTESTCD. egcat EGCAT filter observations . ntime_method field derive nominal time . Allowed values 'TPT', 'TPTNUM' 'ELTM'. Defaults xxTPT xx domain name. NTIME_lookup data frame two columns, column defines custom nominal time information target domain (e.g., 'PCELTM'), 'NTIME'. data frame left_joined observation data frame provide NTIME field. silent Suppress messages. verbose Verbose messages.

title: Create cqtc object — cqtc
code: cqtc(obj = NULL, conc_field = NULL, silent = NULL, rr_threshold = 0.1)

title: Create cqtc object — cqtc
text: obj data frame. conc_field field input data set represents independent concentration variable, 'CONC' provided. silent Suppress warnings, logical. rr_threshold allowed fractional deviation recorded RR interval RR interval back-calculated recorded HR.

code: library(dplyr) library(magrittr)  verapamil_cqtc |>   cqtc_plot(color = "ACTIVE") #> `geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'   dofetilide_cqtc |> filter(ACTIVE == 1) |>   cqtc_plot() #> `geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'

title: Make a cqtc object — new_cqtc
text: minimally required fields : * ID, subject ID numeric * NTIME, nominal time hours numeric * CONC, pharmacokinetic concentration numeric * QTCF, QTcF interval ms, numeric expected fields : * ACTIVE, active/control treatment flag, logical * QT, QT interval ms, numeric * DQTCF, delta QTcF baseline ms, numeric * HR, heart rate 1/min, numeric * RR, RR interval ms, numeric one HR RR included, derived.
